column4: Hello everyone.  I have two questions, both are related to the iPhone
1.  How do I sync an  iPhone to Ubuntu?   I already tried this  http://geeknizer.com/sync-iphone-linux/  The ppa mentioned there doesn't work
Use Rhythmbox, it does it for the music at least
Do you know of any easy way to develop apps using Ubuntu?
That question doesn't make much sense. What programming language are you trying to use?
Would like to use Java, but I don't care.   Seems like the main hurdle is to compile it in a way that the iPhone can run it
Hm, no idea how to compile iPhone stuff without xcode actually, sorry
To be more specific, I would like to write a program in Ubuntu and run it on my iPhone
What if I somehow run Mac OS Lion as a virtual machine and install xcode?
Complicated... Try the Windows version of xcode in wine
If that doesn't work, probably use a Windows VM... macs are hard to install on any VMs
From what I read on the web, I gather it's complicated
This site says that to get xcode running in Windows, you have to still run Mac OS as a virtual machine   http://techexxpert.blogspot.com/2011/08/how-to-virtualize-os-x-lion-on-windows.html
Well I've no idea, I'm not into Apple stuff
Apple sure doesn't make it easy to do things outside of their proprietary OS or hardware.   They seem to be even worse than Windows in that regard
